alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 03 at 10:42PM CDT until June 03 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN BRISCOE AND SWISHER COUNTIES... At 1042 PM CDT, the public reported thunderstorms have resulted in flooded roads in the vicinity of Tulia. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches per hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tulia, Silverton, Vigo Park and Mackenzie Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
